And*p take every man his censer, and put incense in them, and bring ye before the Lord*s every man his censer, two hundred and fifty censers; thou also, and Aaron, each of you his censer.
And*p they took every man his censer, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood in the door of the tabernacle of the congregation with Moses and Aaron.
And*p Korah gathered all the congregation against them unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and the glory of the Lord*s appeared unto all the congregation.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
Separate*p yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.
And*p they fell upon their faces, and said, O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and wilt thou be wroth with all the congregation?
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto the congregation, saying, Get you up from about the tabernacle of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.
And*p Moses rose up and went unto Dathan and Abiram; and the elders of Israel followed him.
And*p he spake unto the congregation, saying, Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest ye be consumed in all their sins.

So*p they gat up from the tabernacle of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side: and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood in the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little children.
And*p Moses said, Hereby ye shall know that the Lord*s hath sent me to do all these works; for I have not done them of mine own mind.
If*p these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men; then the Lord*s hath not sent me.

But*p if the Lord*s make a new thing, and the earth open her mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go down quick into the pit; then ye shall understand that these men have provoked the Lord.*s
And*p it came to pass, as he had made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground clave asunder that was under them:
And*p the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up, and their houses, and all the men that appertained unto Korah, and all their goods.
They,*p and all that appertained to them, went down alive into the pit, and the earth closed upon them: and they perished from among the congregation.
And*p all Israel that were round about them fled at the cry of them: for they said, Lest the earth swallow us up also.
And*p there came out a fire from the Lord,*s and consumed the two hundred and fifty men that offered incense.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, that he take up the censers out of the burning, and scatter thou the fire yonder; for they are hallowed.

The*p censers of these sinners against their own souls, let them make them broad plates for a covering of the altar: for they offered them before the Lord,*s therefore they are hallowed: and they shall be a sign unto the children of Israel.
And*p Eleazar the priest took the brasen censers, wherewith they that were burnt had offered; and they were made broad plates for a covering of the altar:

To*p be a memorial unto the children of Israel, that no stranger, which is not of the seed of Aaron, come near to offer incense before the Lord;*s that he be not as Korah, and as his company: as the Lord*s said to him by the hand of Moses.
But*p on the morrow all the congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, Ye have killed the people of the Lord.*s

And*p it came to pass, when the congregation was gathered against Moses and against Aaron, that they looked toward the tabernacle of the congregation: and, behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of the Lord*s appeared.
And*p Moses and Aaron came before the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Get*p you up from among this congregation, that I may consume them as in a moment. And they fell upon their faces.

And*p Moses said unto Aaron, Take a censer, and put fire therein from off the altar, and put on incense, and go quickly unto the congregation, and make an atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out from the Lord;*s the plague is begun.
And*p Aaron took as Moses commanded, and ran into the midst of the congregation; and, behold, the plague was begun among the people: and he put on incense, and made an atonement for the people.
And*p he stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed.
Now*p they that died in the plague were fourteen thousand and seven hundred, beside them that died about the matter of Korah.
And*p Aaron returned unto Moses unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and the plague was stayed.
Numbers 17
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Speak*p unto the children of Israel, and take of every one of them a rod according to the house of their fathers, of all their princes according to the house of their fathers twelve rods: write thou every man's name upon his rod.
And*p thou shalt write Aaron's name upon the rod of Levi: for one rod shall be for the head of the house of their fathers.
And*p thou shalt lay them up in the tabernacle of the congregation before the testimony, where I will meet with you.
And*p it shall come to pass, that the man's rod, whom I shall choose, shall blossom: and I will make to cease from me the murmurings of the children of Israel, whereby they murmur against you.

And*p Moses spake unto the children of Israel, and every one of their princes gave him a rod apiece, for each prince one, according to their fathers' houses, even twelve rods: and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.
And*p Moses laid up the rods before the Lord*s in the tabernacle of witness.

And*p it came to pass, that on the morrow Moses went into the tabernacle of witness; and, behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and brought forth buds, and bloomed blossoms, and yielded almonds.
And*p Moses brought out all the rods from before the Lord*s unto all the children of Israel: and they looked, and took every man his rod.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Bring Aaron's rod again before the testimony, to be kept for a token against the rebels; and thou shalt quite take away their murmurings from me, that they die not.
And*p Moses did so: as the Lord*s commanded him, so did he.
And*p the children of Israel spake unto Moses, saying, Behold, we die, we perish, we all perish.
Whosoever*p cometh any thing near unto the tabernacle of the Lord*s shall die: shall we be consumed with dying?
Numbers 18

And*p the Lord*s said unto Aaron, Thou and thy sons and thy father's house with thee shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary: and thou and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.

And*p thy brethren also of the tribe of Levi, the tribe of thy father, bring thou with thee, that they may be joined unto thee, and minister unto thee: but thou and thy sons with thee shall minister before the tabernacle of witness.
And*p they shall keep thy charge, and the charge of all the tabernacle: only they shall not come nigh the vessels of the sanctuary and the altar, that neither they, nor ye also, die.
And*p they shall be joined unto thee, and keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, for all the service of the tabernacle: and a stranger shall not come nigh unto you.
And*p ye shall keep the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the altar: that there be no wrath any more upon the children of Israel.
And*p I, behold, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel: to you they are given as a gift for the Lord,*s to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Therefore*p thou and thy sons with thee shall keep your priest's office for every thing of the altar, and within the veil; and ye shall serve: I have given your priest's office unto you as a service of gift: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.

And*p the Lord*s spake unto Aaron, Behold, I also have given thee the charge of mine heave offerings of all the hallowed things of the children of Israel; unto thee have I given them by reason of the anointing, and to thy sons, by an ordinance for ever.

This*p shall be thine of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: every oblation of theirs, every meat offering of theirs, and every sin offering of theirs, and every trespass offering of theirs, which they shall render unto me, shall be most holy for thee and for thy sons.
In*p the most holy place shalt thou eat it; every male shall eat it: it shall be holy unto thee.

And*p this is thine; the heave offering of their gift, with all the wave offerings of the children of Israel: I have given them unto thee, and to thy sons and to thy daughters with thee, by a statute for ever: every one that is clean in thy house shall eat of it.
All*p the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of the wheat, the firstfruits of them which they shall offer unto the Lord,*s them have I given thee.
And*p whatsoever is first ripe in the land, which they shall bring unto the Lord,*s shall be thine; every one that is clean in thine house shall eat of it.
Every*p thing devoted in Israel shall be thine.

Every*p thing that openeth the matrix in all flesh, which they bring unto the Lord,*s whether it be of men or beasts, shall be thine: nevertheless the firstborn of man shalt thou surely redeem, and the firstling of unclean beasts shalt thou redeem.
And*p those that are to be redeemed from a month old shalt thou redeem, according to thine estimation, for the money of five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.

But*p the firstling of a cow, or the firstling of a sheep, or the firstling of a goat, thou shalt not redeem; they are holy: thou shalt sprinkle their blood upon the altar, and shalt burn their fat for an offering made by fire, for a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p the flesh of them shall be thine, as the wave breast and as the right shoulder are thine.

All*p the heave offerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel offer unto the Lord,*s have I given thee, and thy sons and thy daughters with thee, by a statute for ever: it is a covenant of salt for ever before the Lord*s unto thee and to thy seed with thee.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Aaron, Thou shalt have no inheritance in their land, neither shalt thou have any part among them: I am thy part and thine inheritance among the children of Israel.
And,*p behold, I have given the children of Levi all the tenth in Israel for an inheritance, for their service which they serve, even the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Neither*p must the children of Israel henceforth come nigh the tabernacle of the congregation, lest they bear sin, and die.

But*p the Levites shall do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they shall bear their iniquity: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations, that among the children of Israel they have no inheritance.

But*p the tithes of the children of Israel, which they offer as an heave offering unto the Lord,*s I have given to the Levites to inherit: therefore I have said unto them, Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Thus*p speak unto the Levites, and say unto them, When ye take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye shall offer up an heave offering of it for the Lord,*s even a tenth part of the tithe.
And*p this your heave offering shall be reckoned unto you, as though it were the corn of the threshingfloor, and as the fulness of the winepress.
Thus*p ye also shall offer an heave offering unto the Lord*s of all your tithes, which ye receive of the children of Israel; and ye shall give thereof the Lord's*s heave offering to Aaron the priest.
Out*p of all your gifts ye shall offer every heave offering of the Lord,*s of all the best thereof, even the hallowed part thereof out of it.

Therefore*p thou shalt say unto them, When ye have heaved the best thereof from it, then it shall be counted unto the Levites as the increase of the threshingfloor, and as the increase of the winepress.
And*p ye shall eat it in every place, ye and your households: for it is your reward for your service in the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p ye shall bear no sin by reason of it, when ye have heaved from it the best of it: neither shall ye pollute the holy things of the children of Israel, lest ye die.
Numbers 19
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

This*p is the ordinance of the law which the Lord*s hath commanded, saying, Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring thee a red heifer without spot, wherein is no blemish, and upon which never came yoke:
And*p ye shall give her unto Eleazar the priest, that he may bring her forth without the camp, and one shall slay her before his face:
And*p Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle of her blood directly before the tabernacle of the congregation seven times:
And*p one shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn:
And*p the priest shall take cedar wood, and hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer.
Then*p the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the even.
And*p he that burneth her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the even.

And*p a man that is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up without the camp in a clean place, and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water of separation: it is a purification for sin.

And*p he that gathereth the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: and it shall be unto the children of Israel, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them, for a statute for ever.
He*p that toucheth the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days.
He*p shall purify himself with it on the third day, and on the seventh day he shall be clean: but if he purify not himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean.

Whosoever*p toucheth the dead body of any man that is dead, and purifieth not himself, defileth the tabernacle of the Lord;*s and that soul shall be cut off from Israel: because the water of separation was not sprinkled upon him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet upon him.
This*p is the law, when a man dieth in a tent: all that come into the tent, and all that is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days.
And*p every open vessel, which hath no covering bound upon it, is unclean.
And*p whosoever toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the open fields, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
And*p for an unclean person they shall take of the ashes of the burnt heifer of purification for sin, and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel:

And*p a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it upon the tent, and upon all the vessels, and upon the persons that were there, and upon him that touched a bone, or one slain, or one dead, or a grave:

And*p the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify himself, and wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at even.

But*p the man that shall be unclean, and shall not purify himself, that soul shall be cut off from among the congregation, because he hath defiled the sanctuary of the Lord:*s the water of separation hath not been sprinkled upon him; he is unclean.
And*p it shall be a perpetual statute unto them, that he that sprinkleth the water of separation shall wash his clothes; and he that toucheth the water of separation shall be unclean until even.
And*p whatsoever the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean; and the soul that toucheth it shall be unclean until even.
Numbers 20
Then*p came the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, into the desert of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.
And*p there was no water for the congregation: and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
And*p the people chode with Moses, and spake, saying, Would God that we had died when our brethren died before the Lord!*s
And*p why have ye brought up the congregation of the Lord*s into this wilderness, that we and our cattle should die there?
And*p wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.
And*p Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they fell upon their faces: and the glory of the Lord*s appeared unto them.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Take*p the rod, and gather thou the assembly together, thou, and Aaron thy brother, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes; and it shall give forth his water, and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock: so thou shalt give the congregation and their beasts drink.
And*p Moses took the rod from before the Lord,*s as he commanded him.
And*p Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said unto them, Hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch you water out of this rock?
And*p Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice: and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also.

And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.
This*p is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the Lord,*s and he was sanctified in them.
And*p Moses sent messengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the travail that hath befallen us:
How*p our fathers went down into Egypt, and we have dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians vexed us, and our fathers:
And*p when we cried unto the Lord,*s he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and hath brought us forth out of Egypt: and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of thy border:

Let*p us pass, I pray thee, through thy country: we will not pass through the fields, or through the vineyards, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the king's high way, we will not turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed thy borders.
And*p Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not pass by me, lest I come out against thee with the sword.

And*p the children of Israel said unto him, We will go by the high way: and if I and my cattle drink of thy water, then I will pay for it: I will only, without doing any thing else, go through on my feet.
And*p he said, Thou shalt not go through. And Edom came out against him with much people, and with a strong hand.
Thus*p Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border: wherefore Israel turned away from him.
And*p the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto mount Hor.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the coast of the land of Edom, saying,
Aaron*p shall be gathered unto his people: for he shall not enter into the land which I have given unto the children of Israel, because ye rebelled against my word at the water of Meribah.
Take*p Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up unto mount Hor:
And*p strip Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be gathered unto his people, and shall die there.
And*p Moses did as the Lord*s commanded: and they went up into mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
And*p Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.
And*p when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they mourned for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
Numbers 21
And*p when king Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the south, heard tell that Israel came by the way of the spies; then he fought against Israel, and took some of them prisoners.
And*p Israel vowed a vow unto the Lord,*s and said, If thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.
And*p the Lord*s hearkened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities: and he called the name of the place Hormah.
And*p they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way.

And*p the people spake against God, and against Moses, Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loatheth this light bread.
And*p the Lord*s sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and much people of Israel died.

Therefore*p the people came to Moses, and said, We have sinned, for we have spoken against the Lord,*s and against thee; pray unto the Lord,*s that he take away the serpents from us. And Moses prayed for the people.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Make thee a fiery serpent, and set it upon a pole: and it shall come to pass, that every one that is bitten, when he looketh upon it, shall live.
And*p Moses made a serpent of brass, and put it upon a pole, and it came to pass, that if a serpent had bitten any man, when he beheld the serpent of brass, he lived.
And*p the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in Oboth.
And*p they journeyed from Oboth, and pitched at Iyeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrising.
From*p thence they removed, and pitched in the valley of Zered.

From*p thence they removed, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wilderness that cometh out of the coasts of the Amorites: for Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
Wherefore*p it is said in the book of the wars of the Lord,*s What he did in the Red sea, and in the brooks of Arnon,
And*p at the stream of the brooks that goeth down to the dwelling of Ar, and lieth upon the border of Moab.
And*p from thence they went to Beer: that is the well whereof the Lord*s spake unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.
Then*p Israel sang this song, Spring up, O well; sing ye unto it:
The*p princes digged the well, the nobles of the people digged it, by the direction of the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah:
And*p from Mattanah to Nahaliel: and from Nahaliel to Bamoth:
And*p from Bamoth in the valley, that is in the country of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looketh toward Jeshimon.
And*p Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,

Let*p me pass through thy land: we will not turn into the fields, or into the vineyards; we will not drink of the waters of the well: but we will go along by the king's high way, until we be past thy borders.

And*p Sihon would not suffer Israel to pass through his border: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness: and he came to Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
And*p Israel smote him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from Arnon unto Jabbok, even unto the children of Ammon: for the border of the children of Ammon was strong.
And*p Israel took all these cities: and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all the villages thereof.
For*p Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even unto Arnon.
Wherefore*p they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared:
For*p there is a fire gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon: it hath consumed Ar of Moab, and the lords of the high places of Arnon.
Woe*p to thee, Moab! thou art undone, O people of Chemosh: he hath given his sons that escaped, and his daughters, into captivity unto Sihon king of the Amorites.
We*p have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah, which reacheth unto Medeba.
Thus*p Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.
And*p Moses sent to spy out Jaazer, and they took the villages thereof, and drove out the Amorites that were there.
And*p they turned and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he, and all his people, to the battle at Edrei.

And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Fear him not: for I have delivered him into thy hand, and all his people, and his land; and thou shalt do to him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
So*p they smote him, and his sons, and all his people, until there was none left him alive: and they possessed his land.
Numbers 22
And*p the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan by Jericho.
And*p Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
And*p Moab was sore afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.

And*p Moab said unto the elders of Midian, Now shall this company lick up all that are round about us, as the ox licketh up the grass of the field. And Balak the son of Zippor was king of the Moabites at that time.

He*p sent messengers therefore unto Balaam the son of Beor to Pethor, which is by the river of the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt: behold, they cover the face of the earth, and they abide over against me:

Come*p now therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people; for they are too mighty for me: peradventure I shall prevail, that we may smite them, and that I may drive them out of the land: for I wot that he whom thou blessest is blessed, and he whom thou cursest is cursed.
And*p the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand; and they came unto Balaam, and spake unto him the words of Balak.
And*p he said unto them, Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as the Lord*s shall speak unto me: and the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.
And*p God came unto Balaam, and said, What men are these with thee?
And*p Balaam said unto God, Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, hath sent unto me, saying,
Behold,*p there is a people come out of Egypt, which covereth the face of the earth: come now, curse me them; peradventure I shall be able to overcome them, and drive them out.
And*p God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them; thou shalt not curse the people: for they are blessed.
And*p Balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princes of Balak, Get you into your land: for the Lord*s refuseth to give me leave to go with you.
And*p the princes of Moab rose up, and they went unto Balak, and said, Balaam refuseth to come with us.
And*p Balak sent yet again princes, more, and more honourable than they.
And*p they came to Balaam, and said to him, Thus saith Balak the son of Zippor, Let nothing, I pray thee, hinder thee from coming unto me:
For*p I will promote thee unto very great honour, and I will do whatsoever thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.
And*p Balaam answered and said unto the servants of Balak, If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the Lord*s my God, to do less or more.
Now*p therefore, I pray you, tarry ye also here this night, that I may know what the Lord*s will say unto me more.
And*p God came unto Balaam at night, and said unto him, If the men come to call thee, rise up, and go with them; but yet the word which I shall say unto thee, that shalt thou do.
And*p Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his ass, and went with the princes of Moab.
And*p God's anger was kindled because he went: and the angel of the Lord*s stood in the way for an adversary against him. Now he was riding upon his ass, and his two servants were with him.

And*p the ass saw the angel of the Lord*s standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and the ass turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam smote the ass, to turn her into the way.
But*p the angel of the Lord*s stood in a path of the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side.
And*p when the ass saw the angel of the Lord,*s she thrust herself unto the wall, and crushed Balaam's foot against the wall: and he smote her again.
And*p the angel of the Lord*s went further, and stood in a narrow place, where was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
And*p when the ass saw the angel of the Lord,*s she fell down under Balaam: and Balaam's anger was kindled, and he smote the ass with a staff.
And*p the Lord*s opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me these three times?
And*p Balaam said unto the ass, Because thou hast mocked me: I would there were a sword in mine hand, for now would I kill thee.
And*p the ass said unto Balaam, Am not I thine ass, upon which thou hast ridden ever since I was thine unto this day? was I ever wont to do so unto thee? And he said, Nay.
Then*p the Lord*s opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the Lord*s standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and he bowed down his head, and fell flat on his face.
And*p the angel of the Lord*s said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because thy way is perverse before me:
And*p the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times: unless she had turned from me, surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.
And*p Balaam said unto the angel of the Lord,*s I have sinned; for I knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore, if it displease thee, I will get me back again.
And*p the angel of the Lord*s said unto Balaam, Go with the men: but only the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
And*p when Balak heard that Balaam was come, he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab, which is in the border of Arnon, which is in the utmost coast.
And*p Balak said unto Balaam, Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee to honour?
And*p Balaam said unto Balak, Lo, I am come unto thee: have I now any power at all to say any thing? the word that God putteth in my mouth, that shall I speak.
And*p Balaam went with Balak, and they came unto Kirjathhuzoth.
And*p Balak offered oxen and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes that were with him.
And*p it came to pass on the morrow, that Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal, that thence he might see the utmost part of the people.
Numbers 23
And*p Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.
And*p Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram.
And*p Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go: peradventure the Lord*s will come to meet me: and whatsoever he sheweth me I will tell thee. And he went to an high place.
And*p God met Balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon every altar a bullock and a ram.
And*p the Lord*s put a word in Balaam's mouth, and said, Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.
And*p he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he, and all the princes of Moab.
And*p he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, saying, Come, curse me Jacob, and come, defy Israel.
How*p shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? or how shall I defy, whom the Lord*s hath not defied?
For*p from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.
Who*p can count the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his!
And*p Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.
And*p he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the Lord*s hath put in my mouth?

And*p Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence.
And*p he brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
And*p he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, while I meet the Lord*s yonder.
And*p the Lord*s met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, Go again unto Balak, and say thus.
And*p when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath the Lord*s spoken?
And*p he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:
God*p is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?
Behold,*p I have received commandment to bless: and he hath blessed; and I cannot reverse it.
He*p hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the Lord*s his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them.
God*p brought them out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.
Surely*p there is no enchantment against Jacob, neither is there any divination against Israel: according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought!
Behold,*p the people shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drink the blood of the slain.
And*p Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.
But*p Balaam answered and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the Lord*s speaketh, that I must do?
And*p Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.
And*p Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
And*p Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
And*p Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
Numbers 24
And*p when Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord*s to bless Israel, he went not, as at other times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
And*p Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel abiding in his tents according to their tribes; and the spirit of God came upon him.
And*p he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:
He*p hath said, which heard the words of God, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
How*p goodly are thy tents, O Jacob, and thy tabernacles, O Israel!
As*p the valleys are they spread forth, as gardens by the river's side, as the trees of lign aloes which the Lord*s hath planted, and as cedar trees beside the waters.
He*p shall pour the water out of his buckets, and his seed shall be in many waters, and his king shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.
God*p brought him forth out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nations his enemies, and shall break their bones, and pierce them through with his arrows.
He*p couched, he lay down as a lion, and as a great lion: who shall stir him up? Blessed is he that blesseth thee, and cursed is he that curseth thee.

And*p Balak's anger was kindled against Balaam, and he smote his hands together: and Balak said unto Balaam, I called thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed them these three times.
Therefore*p now flee thou to thy place: I thought to promote thee unto great honour; but, lo, the Lord*s hath kept thee back from honour.
And*p Balaam said unto Balak, Spake I not also to thy messengers which thou sentest unto me, saying,
If*p Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the Lord,*s to do either good or bad of mine own mind; but what the Lord*s saith, that will I speak?
And*p now, behold, I go unto my people: come therefore, and I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.
And*p he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:
He*p hath said, which heard the words of God, and knew the knowledge of the most High, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:

I*p shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite the corners of Moab, and destroy all the children of Sheth.
And*p Edom shall be a possession, Seir also shall be a possession for his enemies; and Israel shall do valiantly.
Out*p of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city.
And*p when he looked on Amalek, he took up his parable, and said, Amalek was the first of the nations; but his latter end shall be that he perish for ever.
And*p he looked on the Kenites, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwellingplace, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.
Nevertheless*p the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.
And*p he took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God doeth this!
And*p ships shall come from the coast of Kittim, and shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and he also shall perish for ever.
And*p Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.
Numbers 25
And*p Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab.
And*p they called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods: and the people did eat, and bowed down to their gods.
And*p Israel joined himself unto Baalpeor: and the anger of the Lord*s was kindled against Israel.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people, and hang them up before the Lord*s against the sun, that the fierce anger of the Lord*s may be turned away from Israel.
And*p Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baalpeor.

And,*p behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation, and took a javelin in his hand;
And*p he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.
And*p those that died in the plague were twenty and four thousand.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Phinehas,*p the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.
Wherefore*p say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:
And*p he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.
Now*p the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianite woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.
And*p the name of the Midianite woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was head over a people, and of a chief house in Midian.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Vex*p the Midianites, and smite them:

For*p they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor's sake.
Numbers 26
And*p it came to pass after the plague, that the Lord*s spake unto Moses and unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
Take*p the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, throughout their fathers' house, all that are able to go to war in Israel.
And*p Moses and Eleazar the priest spake with them in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying,
Take*p the sum of the people, from twenty years old and upward; as the Lord*s commanded Moses and the children of Israel, which went forth out of the land of Egypt.
Reuben,*p the eldest son of Israel: the children of Reuben; Hanoch, of whom cometh the family of the Hanochites: of Pallu, the family of the Palluites:
Of*p Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
These*p are the families of the Reubenites: and they that were numbered of them were forty and three thousand and seven hundred and thirty.
And*p the sons of Pallu; Eliab.

And*p the sons of Eliab; Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram. This is that Dathan and Abiram, which were famous in the congregation, who strove against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they strove against the Lord:*s
And*p the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, what time the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men: and they became a sign.
Notwithstanding*p the children of Korah died not.
The*p sons of Simeon after their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites:
Of*p Zerah, the family of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
These*p are the families of the Simeonites, twenty and two thousand and two hundred.
The*p children of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:
Of*p Ozni, the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:
Of*p Arod, the family of the Arodites: of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
These*p are the families of the children of Gad according to those that were numbered of them, forty thousand and five hundred.
The*p sons of Judah were Er and Onan: and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
And*p the sons of Judah after their families were; of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites: of Pharez, the family of the Pharzites: of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites.
And*p the sons of Pharez were; of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
These*p are the families of Judah according to those that were numbered of them, threescore and sixteen thousand and five hundred.
Of*p the sons of Issachar after their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites: of Puah, the family of the Punites:
Of*p Jashub, the family of the Jashubites: of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
These*p are the families of Issachar according to those that were numbered of them, threescore and four thousand and three hundred.
Of*p the sons of Zebulun after their families: of Sered, the family of the Sardites: of Elon, the family of the Elonites: of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
These*p are the families of the Zebulunites according to those that were numbered of them, threescore thousand and five hundred.
The*p sons of Joseph after their families were Manasseh and Ephraim.
Of*p the sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites: and Machir begat Gilead: of Gilead come the family of the Gileadites.
These*p are the sons of Gilead: of Jeezer, the family of the Jeezerites: of Helek, the family of the Helekites:
And*p of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites: and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites:
And*p of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites: and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
And*p Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
These*p are the families of Manasseh, and those that were numbered of them, fifty and two thousand and seven hundred.
These*p are the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the family of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
And*p these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
These*p are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those that were numbered of them, thirty and two thousand and five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph after their families.
The*p sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites:
Of*p Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites: of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
And*p the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites: and of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
These*p are the sons of Benjamin after their families: and they that were numbered of them were forty and five thousand and six hundred.
These*p are the sons of Dan after their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan after their families.
All*p the families of the Shuhamites, according to those that were numbered of them, were threescore and four thousand and four hundred.
Of*p the children of Asher after their families: of Imnah, the family of the Jimnites: of Ishvi, the family of the Jesuites: of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
Of*p the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites: of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
And*p the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
These*p are the families of the sons of Asher according to those that were numbered of them; who were fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
Of*p the sons of Naphtali after their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites: of Guni, the family of the Gunites:
Of*p Jezer, the family of the Jezerites: of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
These*p are the families of Naphtali according to their families: and they that were numbered of them were forty and five thousand and four hundred.
These*p were the numbered of the children of Israel, six hundred thousand and a thousand seven hundred and thirty.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Unto*p these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.
To*p many thou shalt give the more inheritance, and to few thou shalt give the less inheritance: to every one shall his inheritance be given according to those that were numbered of him.
Notwithstanding*p the land shall be divided by lot: according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.
According*p to the lot shall the possession thereof be divided between many and few.

And*p these are they that were numbered of the Levites after their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites: of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites: of Merari, the family of the Merarites.

These*p are the families of the Levites: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korathites. And Kohath begat Amram.
And*p the name of Amram's wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, whom her mother bare to Levi in Egypt: and she bare unto Amram Aaron and Moses, and Miriam their sister.
And*p unto Aaron was born Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
And*p Nadab and Abihu died, when they offered strange fire before the Lord.*s

And*p those that were numbered of them were twenty and three thousand, all males from a month old and upward: for they were not numbered among the children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given them among the children of Israel.
These*p are they that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
But*p among these there was not a man of them whom Moses and Aaron the priest numbered, when they numbered the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
For*p the Lord*s had said of them, They shall surely die in the wilderness. And there was not left a man of them, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
Numbers 27

Then*p came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph: and these are the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
And*p they stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
Our*p father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of them that gathered themselves together against the Lord*s in the company of Korah; but died in his own sin, and had no sons.
Why*p should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he hath no son? Give unto us therefore a possession among the brethren of our father.
And*p Moses brought their cause before the Lord.*s
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

The*p daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father's brethren; and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.
And*p thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die, and have no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.
And*p if he have no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
And*p if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father's brethren.

And*p if his father have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be unto the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Get thee up into this mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.
And*p when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.

For*p ye rebelled against my commandment in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify me at the water before their eyes: that is the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
And*p Moses spake unto the Lord,*s saying,
Let*p the Lord,*s the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
Which*p may go out before them, and which may go in before them, and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the congregation of the Lord*s be not as sheep which have no shepherd.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him;
And*p set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.
And*p thou shalt put some of thine honour upon him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may be obedient.

And*p he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall ask counsel for him after the judgment of Urim before the Lord:*s at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.
And*p Moses did as the Lord*s commanded him: and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation:
And*p he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the Lord*s commanded by the hand of Moses.
Numbers 28
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Command*p the children of Israel, and say unto them, My offering, and my bread for my sacrifices made by fire, for a sweet savour unto me, shall ye observe to offer unto me in their due season.
And*p thou shalt say unto them, This is the offering made by fire which ye shall offer unto the Lord;*s two lambs of the first year without spot day by day, for a continual burnt offering.
The*p one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou offer at even;
And*p a tenth part of an ephah of flour for a meat offering, mingled with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil.
It*p is a continual burnt offering, which was ordained in mount Sinai for a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the Lord.*s
And*p the drink offering thereof shall be the fourth part of an hin for the one lamb: in the holy place shalt thou cause the strong wine to be poured unto the Lord*s for a drink offering.

And*p the other lamb shalt thou offer at even: as the meat offering of the morning, and as the drink offering thereof, thou shalt offer it, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p on the sabbath day two lambs of the first year without spot, and two tenth deals of flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, and the drink offering thereof:
This*p is the burnt offering of every sabbath, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
And*p in the beginnings of your months ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the Lord;*s two young bullocks, and one ram, seven lambs of the first year without spot;
And*p three tenth deals of flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one bullock; and two tenth deals of flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one ram;
And*p a several tenth deal of flour mingled with oil for a meat offering unto one lamb; for a burnt offering of a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the Lord.*s

And*p their drink offerings shall be half an hin of wine unto a bullock, and the third part of an hin unto a ram, and a fourth part of an hin unto a lamb: this is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.
And*p one kid of the goats for a sin offering unto the Lord*s shall be offered, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
And*p in the fourteenth day of the first month is the passover of the Lord.*s
And*p in the fifteenth day of this month is the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
In*p the first day shall be an holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work therein:
But*p ye shall offer a sacrifice made by fire for a burnt offering unto the Lord;*s two young bullocks, and one ram, and seven lambs of the first year: they shall be unto you without blemish:
And*p their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil: three tenth deals shall ye offer for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram;
A*p several tenth deal shalt thou offer for every lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
And*p one goat for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.
Ye*p shall offer these beside the burnt offering in the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.

After*p this manner ye shall offer daily, throughout the seven days, the meat of the sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord:*s it shall be offered beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
And*p on the seventh day ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.
Also*p in the day of the firstfruits, when ye bring a new meat offering unto the Lord,*s after your weeks be out, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work:
But*p ye shall offer the burnt offering for a sweet savour unto the Lord;*s two young bullocks, one ram, seven lambs of the first year;
And*p their meat offering of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto one bullock, two tenth deals unto one ram,
A*p several tenth deal unto one lamb, throughout the seven lambs;
And*p one kid of the goats, to make an atonement for you.
Ye*p shall offer them beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, (they shall be unto you without blemish) and their drink offerings.
Numbers 29
And*p in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing the trumpets unto you.
And*p ye shall offer a burnt offering for a sweet savour unto the Lord;*s one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year without blemish:
And*p their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram,
And*p one tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
And*p one kid of the goats for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you:

Beside*p the burnt offering of the month, and his meat offering, and the daily burnt offering, and his meat offering, and their drink offerings, according unto their manner, for a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the Lord.*s
And*p ye shall have on the tenth day of this seventh month an holy convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls: ye shall not do any work therein:
But*p ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the Lord*s for a sweet savour; one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish:
And*p their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals to a bullock, and two tenth deals to one ram,
A*p several tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
One*p kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the sin offering of atonement, and the continual burnt offering, and the meat offering of it, and their drink offerings.
And*p on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the Lord*s seven days:

And*p ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord;*s thirteen young bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year; they shall be without blemish:
And*p their meat offering shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto every bullock of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth deals to each ram of the two rams,
And*p a several tenth deal to each lamb of the fourteen lambs:
And*p one kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
And*p on the second day ye shall offer twelve young bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without spot:
And*p their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and the meat offering thereof, and their drink offerings.
And*p on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;
And*p their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
And*p on the fourth day ten bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:
Their*p meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one kid of the goats for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
And*p on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without spot:
And*p their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.
And*p on the sixth day eight bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:
And*p their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
And*p on the seventh day seven bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:
And*p their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.
On*p the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembly: ye shall do no servile work therein:
But*p ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord:*s one bullock, one ram, seven lambs of the first year without blemish:
Their*p meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullock, for the ram, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the manner:
And*p one goat for a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.

These*p things ye shall do unto the Lord*s in your set feasts, beside your vows, and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings, and for your meat offerings, and for your drink offerings, and for your peace offerings.
And*p Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the Lord*s commanded Moses.
Numbers 30
And*p Moses spake unto the heads of the tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the Lord*s hath commanded.
If*p a man vow a vow unto the Lord,*s or swear an oath to bind his soul with a bond; he shall not break his word, he shall do according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth.
If*p a woman also vow a vow unto the Lord,*s and bind herself by a bond, being in her father's house in her youth;

And*p her father hear her vow, and her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul, and her father shall hold his peace at her: then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand.

But*p if her father disallow her in the day that he heareth; not any of her vows, or of her bonds wherewith she hath bound her soul, shall stand: and the Lord*s shall forgive her, because her father disallowed her.
And*p if she had at all an husband, when she vowed, or uttered ought out of her lips, wherewith she bound her soul;
And*p her husband heard it, and held his peace at her in the day that he heard it: then her vows shall stand, and her bonds wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.

But*p if her husband disallowed her on the day that he heard it; then he shall make her vow which she vowed, and that which she uttered with her lips, wherewith she bound her soul, of none effect: and the Lord*s shall forgive her.
But*p every vow of a widow, and of her that is divorced, wherewith they have bound their souls, shall stand against her.
And*p if she vowed in her husband's house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath;
And*p her husband heard it, and held his peace at her, and disallowed her not: then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.

But*p if her husband hath utterly made them void on the day he heard them; then whatsoever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand: her husband hath made them void; and the Lord*s shall forgive her.
Every*p vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.

But*p if her husband altogether hold his peace at her from day to day; then he establisheth all her vows, or all her bonds, which are upon her: he confirmeth them, because he held his peace at her in the day that he heard them.
But*p if he shall any ways make them void after that he hath heard them; then he shall bear her iniquity.
These*p are the statutes, which the Lord*s commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, between the father and his daughter, being yet in her youth in her father's house.
Numbers 31
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Avenge*p the children of Israel of the Midianites: afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.
And*p Moses spake unto the people, saying, Arm some of yourselves unto the war, and let them go against the Midianites, and avenge the Lord*s of Midian.
Of*p every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.
So*p there were delivered out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
And*p Moses sent them to the war, a thousand of every tribe, them and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy instruments, and the trumpets to blow in his hand.
And*p they warred against the Midianites, as the Lord*s commanded Moses; and they slew all the males.

And*p they slew the kings of Midian, beside the rest of them that were slain; namely, Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian: Balaam also the son of Beor they slew with the sword.
And*p the children of Israel took all the women of Midian captives, and their little ones, and took the spoil of all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods.
And*p they burnt all their cities wherein they dwelt, and all their goodly castles, with fire.
And*p they took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of men and of beasts.

And*p they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and unto the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by Jordan near Jericho.
And*p Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the princes of the congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp.
And*p Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, with the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the battle.
And*p Moses said unto them, Have ye saved all the women alive?
Behold,*p these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against the Lord*s in the matter of Peor, and there was a plague among the congregation of the Lord.*s
Now*p therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman that hath known man by lying with him.
But*p all the women children, that have not known a man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.

And*p do ye abide without the camp seven days: whosoever hath killed any person, and whosoever hath touched any slain, purify both yourselves and your captives on the third day, and on the seventh day.
And*p purify all your raiment, and all that is made of skins, and all work of goats' hair, and all things made of wood.
And*p Eleazar the priest said unto the men of war which went to the battle, This is the ordinance of the law which the Lord*s commanded Moses;
Only*p the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,

Every*p thing that may abide the fire, ye shall make it go through the fire, and it shall be clean: nevertheless it shall be purified with the water of separation: and all that abideth not the fire ye shall make go through the water.
And*p ye shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterward ye shall come into the camp.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Take*p the sum of the prey that was taken, both of man and of beast, thou, and Eleazar the priest, and the chief fathers of the congregation:
And*p divide the prey into two parts; between them that took the war upon them, who went out to battle, and between all the congregation:
And*p levy a tribute unto the Lord*s of the men of war which went out to battle: one soul of five hundred, both of the persons, and of the beeves, and of the asses, and of the sheep:
Take*p it of their half, and give it unto Eleazar the priest, for an heave offering of the Lord.*s

And*p of the children of Israel's half, thou shalt take one portion of fifty, of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of the flocks, of all manner of beasts, and give them unto the Levites, which keep the charge of the tabernacle of the Lord.*s
And*p Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p the booty, being the rest of the prey which the men of war had caught, was six hundred thousand and seventy thousand and five thousand sheep,
And*p threescore and twelve thousand beeves,
And*p threescore and one thousand asses,
And*p thirty and two thousand persons in all, of women that had not known man by lying with him.
And*p the half, which was the portion of them that went out to war, was in number three hundred thousand and seven and thirty thousand and five hundred sheep:
And*p the Lord's*s tribute of the sheep was six hundred and threescore and fifteen.
And*p the beeves were thirty and six thousand; of which the Lord's*s tribute was threescore and twelve.
And*p the asses were thirty thousand and five hundred; of which the Lord's*s tribute was threescore and one.
And*p the persons were sixteen thousand; of which the Lord's*s tribute was thirty and two persons.
And*p Moses gave the tribute, which was the Lord's*s heave offering, unto Eleazar the priest, as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p of the children of Israel's half, which Moses divided from the men that warred,
(Now*p the half that pertained unto the congregation was three hundred thousand and thirty thousand and seven thousand and five hundred sheep,
And*p thirty and six thousand beeves,
And*p thirty thousand asses and five hundred,
And*p sixteen thousand persons;)

Even*p of the children of Israel's half, Moses took one portion of fifty, both of man and of beast, and gave them unto the Levites, which kept the charge of the tabernacle of the Lord;*s as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p the officers which were over thousands of the host, the captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds, came near unto Moses:
And*p they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.

We*p have therefore brought an oblation for the Lord,*s what every man hath gotten, of jewels of gold, chains, and bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets, to make an atonement for our souls before the Lord.*s
And*p Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of them, even all wrought jewels.
And*p all the gold of the offering that they offered up to the Lord,*s of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
(For*p the men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)

And*p Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tabernacle of the congregation, for a memorial for the children of Israel before the Lord.*s
Numbers 32
Now*p the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of cattle: and when they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that, behold, the place was a place for cattle;
The*p children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spake unto Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of the congregation, saying,
Ataroth,*p and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Shebam, and Nebo, and Beon,
Even*p the country which the Lord*s smote before the congregation of Israel, is a land for cattle, and thy servants have cattle:
Wherefore,*p said they, if we have found grace in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy servants for a possession, and bring us not over Jordan.
And*p Moses said unto the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben, Shall your brethren go to war, and shall ye sit here?
And*p wherefore discourage ye the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the Lord*s hath given them?
Thus*p did your fathers, when I sent them from Kadeshbarnea to see the land.
For*p when they went up unto the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which the Lord*s had given them.
And*p the Lord's*s anger was kindled the same time, and he sware, saying,

Surely*p none of the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me:
Save*p Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite, and Joshua the son of Nun: for they have wholly followed the Lord.*s
And*p the Lord's*s anger was kindled against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation, that had done evil in the sight of the Lord,*s was consumed.
And,*p behold, ye are risen up in your fathers' stead, an increase of sinful men, to augment yet the fierce anger of the Lord*s toward Israel.
For*p if ye turn away from after him, he will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and ye shall destroy all this people.
And*p they came near unto him, and said, We will build sheepfolds here for our cattle, and cities for our little ones:

But*p we ourselves will go ready armed before the children of Israel, until we have brought them unto their place: and our little ones shall dwell in the fenced cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
We*p will not return unto our houses, until the children of Israel have inherited every man his inheritance.
For*p we will not inherit with them on yonder side Jordan, or forward; because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side Jordan eastward.
And*p Moses said unto them, If ye will do this thing, if ye will go armed before the Lord*s to war,
And*p will go all of you armed over Jordan before the Lord,*s until he hath driven out his enemies from before him,
And*p the land be subdued before the Lord:*s then afterward ye shall return, and be guiltless before the Lord,*s and before Israel; and this land shall be your possession before the Lord.*s
But*p if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sinned against the Lord:*s and be sure your sin will find you out.
Build*p you cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which hath proceeded out of your mouth.
And*p the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spake unto Moses, saying, Thy servants will do as my lord commandeth.
Our*p little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our cattle, shall be there in the cities of Gilead:
But*p thy servants will pass over, every man armed for war, before the Lord*s to battle, as my lord saith.
So*p concerning them Moses commanded Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel:

And*p Moses said unto them, If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over Jordan, every man armed to battle, before the Lord,*s and the land shall be subdued before you; then ye shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession:
But*p if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.
And*p the children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, As the Lord*s hath said unto thy servants, so will we do.
We*p will pass over armed before the Lord*s into the land of Canaan, that the possession of our inheritance on this side Jordan may be ours.

And*p Moses gave unto them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and unto half the tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land, with the cities thereof in the coasts, even the cities of the country round about.
And*p the children of Gad built Dibon, and Ataroth, and Aroer,
And*p Atroth Shophan, and Jaazer, and Jogbehah,
And*p Bethnimrah, and Bethharan, fenced cities: and folds for sheep.
And*p the children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kiriathaim,
And*p Nebo, and Baalmeon, (their names being changed,) and Sibmah: and gave other names unto the cities which they builded.
And*p the children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, and took it, and dispossessed the Amorite which was in it.
And*p Moses gave Gilead unto Machir the son of Manasseh; and he dwelt therein.
And*p Jair the son of Manasseh went and took the small towns thereof, and called them Havothjair.
And*p Nobah went and took Kenath, and the villages thereof, and called it Nobah, after his own name.
Numbers 33
These*p are the journeys of the children of Israel, which went forth out of the land of Egypt with their armies under the hand of Moses and Aaron.
And*p Moses wrote their goings out according to their journeys by the commandment of the Lord:*s and these are their journeys according to their goings out.

And*p they departed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the morrow after the passover the children of Israel went out with an high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians.
For*p the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the Lord*s had smitten among them: upon their gods also the Lord*s executed judgments.
And*p the children of Israel removed from Rameses, and pitched in Succoth.
And*p they departed from Succoth, and pitched in Etham, which is in the edge of the wilderness.
And*p they removed from Etham, and turned again unto Pihahiroth, which is before Baalzephon: and they pitched before Migdol.
And*p they departed from before Pihahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, and went three days' journey in the wilderness of Etham, and pitched in Marah.
And*p they removed from Marah, and came unto Elim: and in Elim were twelve fountains of water, and threescore and ten palm trees; and they pitched there.
And*p they removed from Elim, and encamped by the Red sea.
And*p they removed from the Red sea, and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.
And*p they took their journey out of the wilderness of Sin, and encamped in Dophkah.
And*p they departed from Dophkah, and encamped in Alush.
And*p they removed from Alush, and encamped at Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drink.
And*p they departed from Rephidim, and pitched in the wilderness of Sinai.
And*p they removed from the desert of Sinai, and pitched at Kibrothhattaavah.
And*p they departed from Kibrothhattaavah, and encamped at Hazeroth.
And*p they departed from Hazeroth, and pitched in Rithmah.
And*p they departed from Rithmah, and pitched at Rimmonperez.
And*p they departed from Rimmonperez, and pitched in Libnah.
And*p they removed from Libnah, and pitched at Rissah.
And*p they journeyed from Rissah, and pitched in Kehelathah.
And*p they went from Kehelathah, and pitched in mount Shapher.
