And*p they removed from mount Shapher, and encamped in Haradah.
And*p they removed from Haradah, and pitched in Makheloth.
And*p they removed from Makheloth, and encamped at Tahath.
And*p they departed from Tahath, and pitched at Tarah.
And*p they removed from Tarah, and pitched in Mithcah.
And*p they went from Mithcah, and pitched in Hashmonah.
And*p they departed from Hashmonah, and encamped at Moseroth.
And*p they departed from Moseroth, and pitched in Benejaakan.
And*p they removed from Benejaakan, and encamped at Horhaggiggad.
And*p they went from Horhaggiggad, and pitched in Jotbathah.
And*p they removed from Jotbathah, and encamped at Ebronah.
And*p they departed from Ebronah, and encamped at Eziongeber.
And*p they removed from Eziongeber, and pitched in the wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
And*p they removed from Kadesh, and pitched in mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.

And*p Aaron the priest went up into mount Hor at the commandment of the Lord,*s and died there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the first day of the fifth month.
And*p Aaron was an hundred and twenty and three years old when he died in mount Hor.
And*p king Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the south in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.
And*p they departed from mount Hor, and pitched in Zalmonah.
And*p they departed from Zalmonah, and pitched in Punon.
And*p they departed from Punon, and pitched in Oboth.
And*p they departed from Oboth, and pitched in Iyeabarim, in the border of Moab.
And*p they departed from Iim, and pitched in Dibongad.
And*p they removed from Dibongad, and encamped in Almondiblathaim.
And*p they removed from Almondiblathaim, and pitched in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
And*p they departed from the mountains of Abarim, and pitched in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
And*p they pitched by Jordan, from Bethjeshimoth even unto Abelshittim in the plains of Moab.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye are passed over Jordan into the land of Canaan;
Then*p ye shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, and destroy all their pictures, and destroy all their molten images, and quite pluck down all their high places:
And*p ye shall dispossess the inhabitants of the land, and dwell therein: for I have given you the land to possess it.

And*p ye shall divide the land by lot for an inheritance among your families: and to the more ye shall give the more inheritance, and to the fewer ye shall give the less inheritance: every man's inheritance shall be in the place where his lot falleth; according to the tribes of your fathers ye shall inherit.

But*p if ye will not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you; then it shall come to pass, that those which ye let remain of them shall be pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides, and shall vex you in the land wherein ye dwell.
Moreover*p it shall come to pass, that I shall do unto you, as I thought to do unto them.
Numbers 34
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Command*p the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land of Canaan; (this is the land that shall fall unto you for an inheritance, even the land of Canaan with the coasts thereof:)
Then*p your south quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin along by the coast of Edom, and your south border shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea eastward:

And*p your border shall turn from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim, and pass on to Zin: and the going forth thereof shall be from the south to Kadeshbarnea, and shall go on to Hazaraddar, and pass on to Azmon:
And*p the border shall fetch a compass from Azmon unto the river of Egypt, and the goings out of it shall be at the sea.
And*p as for the western border, ye shall even have the great sea for a border: this shall be your west border.
And*p this shall be your north border: from the great sea ye shall point out for you mount Hor:
From*p mount Hor ye shall point out your border unto the entrance of Hamath; and the goings forth of the border shall be to Zedad:
And*p the border shall go on to Ziphron, and the goings out of it shall be at Hazarenan: this shall be your north border.
And*p ye shall point out your east border from Hazarenan to Shepham:
And*p the coast shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain; and the border shall descend, and shall reach unto the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward:
And*p the border shall go down to Jordan, and the goings out of it shall be at the salt sea: this shall be your land with the coasts thereof round about.
And*p Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, This is the land which ye shall inherit by lot, which the Lord*s commanded to give unto the nine tribes, and to the half tribe:

For*p the tribe of the children of Reuben according to the house of their fathers, and the tribe of the children of Gad according to the house of their fathers, have received their inheritance; and half the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance:
The*p two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan near Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
These*p are the names of the men which shall divide the land unto you: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.
And*p ye shall take one prince of every tribe, to divide the land by inheritance.
And*p the names of the men are these: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
And*p of the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.
Of*p the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.
And*p the prince of the tribe of the children of Dan, Bukki the son of Jogli.
The*p prince of the children of Joseph, for the tribe of the children of Manasseh, Hanniel the son of Ephod.
And*p the prince of the tribe of the children of Ephraim, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.
And*p the prince of the tribe of the children of Zebulun, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.
And*p the prince of the tribe of the children of Issachar, Paltiel the son of Azzan.
And*p the prince of the tribe of the children of Asher, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.
And*p the prince of the tribe of the children of Naphtali, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.
These*p are they whom the Lord*s commanded to divide the inheritance unto the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.
Numbers 35
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying,

Command*p the children of Israel, that they give unto the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and ye shall give also unto the Levites suburbs for the cities round about them.
And*p the cities shall they have to dwell in; and the suburbs of them shall be for their cattle, and for their goods, and for all their beasts.
And*p the suburbs of the cities, which ye shall give unto the Levites, shall reach from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits round about.

And*p ye shall measure from without the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits; and the city shall be in the midst: this shall be to them the suburbs of the cities.

And*p among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites there shall be six cities for refuge, which ye shall appoint for the manslayer, that he may flee thither: and to them ye shall add forty and two cities.
So*p all the cities which ye shall give to the Levites shall be forty and eight cities: them shall ye give with their suburbs.

And*p the cities which ye shall give shall be of the possession of the children of Israel: from them that have many ye shall give many; but from them that have few ye shall give few: every one shall give of his cities unto the Levites according to his inheritance which he inheriteth.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come over Jordan into the land of Canaan;
Then*p ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at unawares.
And*p they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.
And*p of these cities which ye shall give six cities shall ye have for refuge.
Ye*p shall give three cities on this side Jordan, and three cities shall ye give in the land of Canaan, which shall be cities of refuge.
These*p six cities shall be a refuge, both for the children of Israel, and for the stranger, and for the sojourner among them: that every one that killeth any person unawares may flee thither.
And*p if he smite him with an instrument of iron, so that he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.
And*p if he smite him with throwing a stone, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.
Or*p if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.
The*p revenger of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him.
But*p if he thrust him of hatred, or hurl at him by laying of wait, that he die;
Or*p in enmity smite him with his hand, that he die: he that smote him shall surely be put to death; for he is a murderer: the revenger of blood shall slay the murderer, when he meeteth him.
But*p if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait,
Or*p with any stone, wherewith a man may die, seeing him not, and cast it upon him, that he die, and was not his enemy, neither sought his harm:
Then*p the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the revenger of blood according to these judgments:

And*p the congregation shall deliver the slayer out of the hand of the revenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge, whither he was fled: and he shall abide in it unto the death of the high priest, which was anointed with the holy oil.
But*p if the slayer shall at any time come without the border of the city of his refuge, whither he was fled;
And*p the revenger of blood find him without the borders of the city of his refuge, and the revenger of blood kill the slayer; he shall not be guilty of blood:
Because*p he should have remained in the city of his refuge until the death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest the slayer shall return into the land of his possession.
So*p these things shall be for a statute of judgment unto you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
Whoso*p killeth any person, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person to cause him to die.
Moreover*p ye shall take no satisfaction for the life of a murderer, which is guilty of death: but he shall be surely put to death.
And*p ye shall take no satisfaction for him that is fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.
So*p ye shall not pollute the land wherein ye are: for blood it defileth the land: and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it.
Defile*p not therefore the land which ye shall inhabit, wherein I dwell: for I the Lord*s dwell among the children of Israel.
Numbers 36

And*p the chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spake before Moses, and before the princes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel:

And*p they said, The Lord*s commanded my lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commanded by the Lord*s to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother unto his daughters.

And*p if they be married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and shall be put to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot of our inheritance.

And*p when the jubilee of the children of Israel shall be, then shall their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.
And*p Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the Lord,*s saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph hath said well.

This*p is the thing which the Lord*s doth command concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them marry to whom they think best; only to the family of the tribe of their father shall they marry.
So*p shall not the inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe: for every one of the children of Israel shall keep himself to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

And*p every daughter, that possesseth an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel, shall be wife unto one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may enjoy every man the inheritance of his fathers.
Neither*p shall the inheritance remove from one tribe to another tribe; but every one of the tribes of the children of Israel shall keep himself to his own inheritance.
Even*p as the Lord*s commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad:
For*p Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married unto their father's brothers' sons:
And*p they were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
These*p are the commandments and the judgments, which the Lord*s commanded by the hand of Moses unto the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
